name: ITP0006 – Pavement Type 3 PT03 CONCRETE PAVEMENT DETAIL
template name: ITP0006 – Pavement Type 3 PT03 CONCRETE PAVEMENT DETAIL

name: CRITERIA - Subgrade to withstand test rolling NA according to S.D.X10
CRITERIA - Subgrade Compaction NA according to S.D.X.10
CRITERIA - Earthworks shall be finished to conform to the levels, lines, grades and cross-sections specified or shown on the drawings
• Width: ± 50mm from right angles to the design line.
• Level: mean deviation from design no more than +15 to -30mm, max. below the specified level
• Thickness: Not more than 15mm less than the specified thickness.
• Shape: No point on the surface of the pavement layer shall vary by more than 8mm from a 3m straight edge or 10mm from a 6m straight edge.
CRITERIA - No compaction testing required for subgrade according to S.D.X10
CRITERIA - Material: 75MM THICK CLASS 3 20MM FINE CRUSHED CONCRETE RECYCLED
VALUE - 75MM THICK CLASS 3 20MM FINE CRUSHED ROCK
• Thickness: Not more or less than the specified thickness. 75MM
• Width: +/- 50mm from right angles to the design line.
• Level: Mean deviation from design no more than +6 to -10mm, max. standard deviation 10.
• Shape: No point on the surface of the pavement layer shall vary by more than 8mm from a 3m straight edge or 10mm from a 6m straight edge.
CRITERIA - Concrete pour 32Mpa 14mm aggregate 80mm slump – 100mm thick, with dowelled expansion joints every 12 meter max centres.
• Saw cut / tools joints every 1.5 max centres each way.
• No Colour oxide as specified by council inspection team to best match environment and existing local infrastructure
1.1 - Nominal cover of 50mm unless noted otherwise
CRITERIA - Check cover requirements as per IFC drawings & concrete specification document.
CRITERIA - Reinforcement is adequately tied to prevent movement during pouring. Fixing to be as per standard.
CRITERIA - Reinforcement as per IFC drawings
CRITERIA - Curing carried out as per IFC drawings / concrete specification
CRITERIA - Formwork stripped in accordance with specified times on IFC drawings / specifications
CRITERIA - Repair grout to be higher strength than substrate concrete
4.4 - All areas are clean from slurry
CRITERIA - Surfaces to be cleaned after pour if required
